# VStack

**Structure**

A view that arranges its subviews in a vertical line.

## Declaration

```swift
@frozen struct VStack<Content> where Content : View
```

## Overview

Unlike [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/LazyVStack], which only renders the views when your app needs to display them, a `VStack` renders the views all at once, regardless of whether they are on- or offscreen. Use the regular `VStack` when you have a small number of subviews or don’t want the delayed rendering behavior of the “lazy” version.

The following example shows a simple vertical stack of 10 text views:

```swift
var body: some View {
    VStack(
        alignment: .leading,
        spacing: 10
    ) {
        ForEach(
            1...10,
            id: \.self
        ) {
            Text("Item \($0)")
        }
    }
}
```





## Creating a stack

- **init(alignment:spacing:content:)**: Creates an instance with the given spacing and horizontal alignment.

## Statically arranging views in one dimension

- **Building layouts with stack views**: Compose complex layouts from primitive container views.
- **HStack**: A view that arranges its subviews in a horizontal line.

## Conforms To

- View
